About.name: Coventry University
About.about:
Coventry University is a place where you can achieve your ambitions. We get you ready for the real world with a focus on employability, practical learning, and personalised support throughout your time at university. When you study at Coventry, you get the knowledge and skills you need for your chosen career, but you also get our support to develop confidence in yourself and your abilities which will be invaluable when you go on to pursue your ambitions.
We were awarded a Gold rating in the 2023 Teaching Excellence Framework, showing we deliver excellence in what students care most about – teaching, learning and achieving positive outcomes from their studies.
About.whatMakesUsDifferent:
Success Coaches
We know that every university offers student support, but do they give you access to a person who’ll get to know you as an individual and help you to get the most out of your student experience? We do.
Success Coaches can help you to:
differenceList: Manage your studies. This could be supporting you in meeting deadlines, managing workload and balancing your studies.
Access support services. If you need help or advice, your Success Coach can connect you with the services you need. This could be career support, counselling, advice on fees and funding and more.
Develop key skills. Your studies are important but life skills such as budgeting, resilience and problem-solving are key to help you achieve your future goals and ensure you graduate with confidence.
Prepare for the world of work. With the help of our careers team, your Success Coach will help you prepare for life after uni.

Stats.heading: Stats
Stats.description: Statistics and reviews are supplied by trusted partners and are independent to UCAS. You should also consider attending an open day and talking to staff and students.

StudentLife.heading: Student life
studentLifeParagraphs: We know your student experience isn’t just about your grades, it’s also about making friends, trying new things and discovering who you are as a person.  You can join a society or sports club through Your Students’ Union which you will automatically become a member of when you study here. There are nearly 100 societies and 40 sports clubs to choose from so there’s something for everyone. You can explore the city and enjoy activities such as shopping, nightlife and local green spaces.

Our support services help you get the most out of your time at university. You’ll have access to a Student Success Coach who will work with you to create a personal success plan. They are there for you, to help you access the broad range of support we offer, from help with your studies to support with your mental health and wellbeing.
Our Phoenix+ programme offers extra and co-curricular activities to help you build core life skills.

regionGuides.heading: What's it like to live in West Midlands?Check out our region guide
paragraphs: The West Midlands is made up of Herefordshire, Shropshire, Staffordshire, Warwickshire, and Worcestershire. Its main cities are Birmingham, Coventry, and Wolverhampton.

It’s the most diverse part of the country behind London, with a proud multicultural history, from the birth of Two-Tone music in Coventry – a combination of Caribbean ska and English punk – to the Balti curry, courtesy of Birmingham’s Pakistani community.
Once the heart of heavy industry and manufacturing, and the inspiration for Peaky Blinders, Birmingham is one of the youngest cities in Europe, with over 40% under 25 years old.

regionGuides.heading: What's it like to live in Coventry?Check out our city guide
paragraphs: Discover what it’s really like to live in Coventry as an international student – from top food spots to affordable housing, travel tips, and unforgettable day trips.

campusParagraphs: Coventry is one of the UK’s most multicultural cities with our city-centre campus continually developing and plans for further investment, it is an exciting time to study at Coventry University. It’s a welcoming place with a rich cultural history. From galleries and cathedrals to nightclubs, street food markets and live music venues – our city has it all. Our campus in the centre of the city, puts you at the heart of things.
We offer accommodation options for all our six intakes, including halls of residence, studios, and private accommodation, most within walking distance of our campuses.
There are several benefits, to living in our student accommodation.

Courses.heading: Courses
paragraphs: We have over 140 courses to choose from, including subjects like Nursing, Law, Art and Design and Engineering.

At Coventry University, our courses are designed with employability in mind. We are proud to offer immersive learning experiences that give you the chance to use what you’re learning, in physical settings and simulated situations that look and feel like real life. This gets you ready for your future career by preparing you with hands-on experience.
Some of our courses are accredited which could give you a real head start in your chosen career, often counting towards professional qualifications.

We even offer courses which share a common first year. This will give you the chance to meet, mix and learn with students from other related courses and you may also be able to switch courses at the end of the first year if you decide to change your focus.
Whatever you’re planning to do with your life, we have a course that will help you get there.

International.heading: International
paragraphs: As a truly global university group, we have more than 16,000 international students of 121 different nationalities studying with us in the UK.*
* Coventry University Group, QS World University Rankings 2025.
International Student Support

Friendly, multilingual staff are your first point of contact for any questions or queries. They are available to chat with before you start with us and throughout your studies. They can answer questions on topics such as the application process, visas, and payment of fees.
Applying to university is a big step, especially if you're looking to study at a university in another country. Visit our international students hub for more information on how we can support you.

StudentSupport.heading: Student support
paragraphs: We offer a range of support to help you make the most of your time at university.
Wellbeing support
One-to-one student support

Sometimes, you might need that extra help and guidance. That’s why you’ll have access to a Success Coach from day one. Our qualified coaches can provide one-to-one support and mentoring throughout your academic journey. They can also connect you with additional personal and academic support should you need it.
Careers and employability support

We offer professional career and employability support from enrolment to 36 months after you graduate. We can help you find work placements, graduate roles and explore further study options, including study abroad opportunities. The team also provide a range of personalised support from general careers guidance, to CV advice and job application checks, to mentoring, skills workshops and employer networking events.
Phoenix+

Phoenix+ is Coventry University’s programme designed to support your personal and professional growth. Running alongside your academic studies, you can access tailored resources, experiences and guidance to get you ready for life after university.
Fair Access Scheme

At Coventry University, we consider your potential beyond just grades through our Fair Access Scheme, available for all undergraduate courses. Depending on your circumstances, you may be eligible for a reduced offer of up to 24 UCAS Tariff points or equivalent.
Learn more about our student support services.
